intro: Ocimum villosum, commonly known as velvet leaf basil, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, pale blue or white flowers. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their aromatic and antiseptic properties. Ocimum villosum is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like mint and oregano.
